description: From Arabic سَمُوم‎ (samūm, “hot wind”), from سَمَّ‎ (samma, “to poison”).

entries.meaning: A hot, dry, suffocating, dust-laden wind of the desert, particularly of Arabia, Syria, and neighboring countries, generated by the extreme heat of the parched deserts or sandy plains.
examples: Stephen's heart had withered up like a flower of the desert that feels the simoom coming from afar.
